title: thousands child slaves carrying knives
story: NewsThousands of child slaves carrying knives to fend off gangs behind £1.8bn drugs trade'County Lines' bosses groom kids as young as 11 and force them to deliver cocaine and heroin ordered via special hotlines&nbspShareByDan Warburton20:30, 23 JUN 2018Updated21:02, 23 JUN 2018NewsThere were 5,000 children picked up by authorities last year over slavery fears (Image: PA)&nbspShareGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThousands of child slaves are being armed with knives to fend off rival gangs behind a &pound1.8billion-a-year drugs trade, the Sunday Mirror can reveal. So-called County Lines bosses groom kids as young as 11 and force them to deliver cocaine and heroin ordered via special hotlines. But the level of violence is soaring and youngsters are handed weapons in case rivals try to steal their stash. We can also reveal that exploited children are even being “traded in” as gangsters sell off lucrative hotlines. Dealers build up a client base of drug users before selling the list for tens of thousands of pounds – and throwing in their child workforce.  The National Crime Agency believes more than 1,000 gangs are operating hotlines. The NCA has at least 200 live operations in place to smash the rings. Each line can make &pound5,000 a day – &pound1.8million a year. The grim trade sees:  Children having drugs forced inside their bodies – known as “plugging” – and trafficked nationwide. Horrific videos of attacks and revenge beatings shared on social media to intimidate rivals and warn gang members wanting to break free. Recruits subjected to sexual abuse or forced into prostitution. Social media sites like Periscope used by gangsters “like CCTV” to keep tabs on youngsters out on the streets.   Junior Smart, who leads the SOS Project with the St Giles Trust, said: “People are saying this is happening in deprived areas with specific demographics. People expect it to be &shytypically a black youth, hoodie up and wearing a manbag. “That’s not how it works. It can start with simply being offered drugs and within days they have debt bondage and are stuck in the criminal world. “Even middle class children are getting involved because their families have the means to pay off debts and gang leaders can earn cash. “People have been recruited from primary school age. Others have mental health problems, learning difficulties. Gangs hang around school gates and see those who are being bullied, alone and are easy targets. “They target youth hostels, referral units. It’s an immediate workforce for them. One of the biggest problems is children – thousands of them – not being reported when they go missing.” The revelations come just days after police seized a 10in hunting knife as they smashed a gang supplying heroin and crack cocaine from London’s East End to Ipswich, Suffolk. And in April gang leaders Mahad Yusuf, 21, and Fesal Mahamud, 20, were jailed for a total of 19 years for trafficking a teen from Enfield, North London, to Wales.  Kids are promised cash, a flashy lifestyle, friendship and respect. But once sucked in they are invited to share drugs – only to be landed with massive debts that they must work off. It is understood 5,000 children were picked up by authorities last year over fears they were forced into slavery. That was 35 per cent up in a year. The NCA has revealed grim details of sexual abuse, while politicians have told of their fears for trapped kids. Labour’s Ann Coffey, who chairs the All Party Parliamentary Group for Runaway and Missing Children and Adults, said: “The extent of the violence is new – and it’s reaching into almost every small town in the UK.”

title: 11 best spots uk watch
story: Advertorial11 best spots in the UK to watch an amazing sunset this summerThis week marks the summer solstice – and is also the official start of summer. So what better time to explore the UK and take in some of the country’s most breathtaking bike rides?&nbspShareByHolly Thatcher14:24, 22 JUN 2018Updated21:07, 23 JUN 2018Advertorial (Image: Getty)&nbspShareGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailWe've been blessed with some decent weather already in 2018 - but this week is when summer *officially* begins. June 21, the summer solstice in the Northern Hemisphere, is the longest day in the year - affording us approximately 17 hours of daylight. Technically, this also means that the nights will start drawing in again now - so there's really no time like the present to get out and explore the great outdoors on some of the country’s most breathtaking bike rides. We've taken a look around the UK to find the best places to watch the sun setting. 1. Museum of Scottish Lighthouses, Fraserburgh, Scotland  A small village called Maud in Aberdeenshire offers a starting place for a traffic-free cycle to the coast. If you're in the mood to learn then head to the Museum of Scottish Lighthouses in Fraserburgh. The sun will set at around 10.12pm this week in this part of Scotland, so you've got loads of time to enjoy the start of the summer. Bike need replacing?   If your existing bike needs replacing, you'll want something efficient and speedy for the roads - like the Carrera Parva Hybrid bike , which comes in versions for both men and women and is now just &pound210 (a saving of &pound90). And if you don't need a new bike, why not have yours checked over before setting off. Like any mode of transport your bike needs to be looked after and regularly checked for wear and tear. Halfords offers a 32-point Free Bike Check which includes:  Frame, saddle and handlebar Wheels including tyres, rims, spokes and hubs Brake system including levers, calipers, pads and cables / hoses Drivetrain including gears, levers, chain, bottom bracket, cranks and cables  2. The Eden Project, Cornwall   Why not spend the day enjoying the amazing sights at the Eden Project? Best of all, if you arrive by bike you'll get a discount on entry. The sun sets on Eden at around 9:30pm on the solstice. Bear in mind though that the Eden Project shuts at 6pm, so you'll need to watch the sun go down somewhere nearby.  Get there in style on the Carrera Subway 1 Hybrid Bike , &pound300. With easy to use 24 speed Shimano gearing, your effort for building speed will be minimised on all terrains, while its lightweight aluminium frame means you can quickly and efficiently ride to your destination. Camping out?   Planning to camp? Be sure you book in advance as you won't want to be without a pitch. Croft Farm Holiday Park is just a mile from the Eden Project and three miles from the beach. Pentewan Sands is also nearby and boasts amazing family facilities - as well as the nearby Pentewan Cycle Trail. Consider taking a Halfords Vis A Vis 4 Person Tent with you, which is currently reduced to just &pound60, (was &pound150, save &pound90). The simple tunnel design is easy to pitch in approximately 20 minutes. With two separate bedrooms and a living area, it's perfect for families or groups of friends. For additional comfort pack an Urban Escape Folding Table And Bench Set , &pound40 (was &pound50, save &pound10) which folds down into a single carry case to make it easy to transport and store.  3. Pembrokeshire Coast National Park, Wales  The Pembrokeshire Coast Path is an absolutely beautiful part of Wales and a stunning place to watch the sun go down. There are loads of campsites in the area, including some unique places to stay. There are plenty of bike routes too, with some offering traffic-free options if you want a more peaceful ride. In Pembrokeshire you can expect the sun to set around 9:39pm. Why not try..   The Boardman ADV 8.8 Adventure Bike , &pound750, is a bike truly made to help you explore new possibilities. This bike is adept at riding in comfort on roads but really excels when you want to get off the beaten track.   4. White Nancy, Cheshire   Located on Kerridge Hill, White Nancy is a local landmark from which you can see all around the area, from Wales to the west and the Pennines to the north. From time to time White Nancy is painted to look like other things, like a Christmas pudding or with Olympic rings when London hosted in 2012. The sun will set over White Nancy at around 9:36 this week. Need to drive?  Heading further afield to enjoy the sunny days? If you're packing up the whole family into the car for a camping trip, make sure it's in good running order first. A Free Car Check performed by Halfords experts will put your mind at rest. Book online or just pop in to your local Halfords store and trained colleagues will carry out a free car bulb check and check your battery, wiper blades, engine oil level and air conditioning, and check for any windscreen chips. They'll even give you a free screenwash top-up too.  If you're making an unfamiliar journey, don't forget to get the Garmin Drive Sat Nav , &pound79.99 (was &pound99.99, save &pound20.99). With lifetime map updates you're never going to find yourself driving down a newly-closed street or down a disused road. 5. Edinburgh Castle, Scotland  There are few places that are as stunning as Edinburgh Castle, located atop Castle Rock. The views of Edinburgh from the castle are amazing, and a great place to watch the end of the day roll around. Sunset here will take place at 9:58pm. 6. Hampstead Heath, London  The scenery on Hampstead Heath always pleases the eye. This amazing part of London has views of every landmark you could hope for and it's a wonderful place to watch the sun go down. This will happen at around 9:18pm in the capital.   7. Osborne House, Isle of Wight   The home of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert is quite a sight to see. Accessible by bike (and ferry, if you're not an island resident), it's the ideal place to see during the day before you settle down somewhere to watch the sunset. If you're up for the cycle, Shanklin Chine on the west of the island is well worth an evening visit.  Do it with ease - and classic style - on the Pendleton Somerby Electric Hybrid Bike , &pound750. With added electrically powered pedal assistance, it delivers 40 - 50 miles of range through a rear hub motor with speed sensor. This extra power is enough to guarantee effortless rides, taking the strain out of hills and making moving off from a standstill much easier. If you prefer, this bike is also available in a non electric version and in a range of colours - we love the mint green ! The sunset starts at 9:18pm near Osborne House and 9:17pm in Shanklin Chine.  8. Ness Point, Lowestoft    Ness Point is the UK's most easterly point. This makes it a great place to ride to on National Cycle Route 1. Make yourself comfortable on the Halfords XL Waterproof Picnic Blanket , &pound10 (half price) and watch the waves crash in as the sun goes down. Sunset is 9:16 at the UK's most easterly point.  9. Blackpool Pleasure Beach, Lancashire   With plenty of places to cycle in the area you could have an amazing day out in Blackpool. Start with a ride to the Pleasure Beach, and have some fun with the kids (or without them!) on the roller coasters. When all that's done you can have fish and chips while the sun sets on another day. The sun will go set at around 9:43 in Blackpool.  10. Cotswolds, England  Spread over six counties there's a lot to see in the Cotswolds. Consider taking a ride through the picturesque Castle Combe to take in the amazing houses and the stunning market square. The sun sets on this beautiful village at 9:26pm  Find your way by car - and beat the traffic   If you're driving to somewhere new then why not add a sat nav to your car? The TomTom GO 6200 , &pound270, (was &pound339.99, save &pound69.99) adds real-time traffic information to the navigational benefits of a sat nav (smartphone required for this feature).   11. Giant's Causeway, Northern Ireland

story: NewsBritain's most pothole-plagued roads revealed as councils heave with complaintsShocking survey across country comes after study found our roads are worse than in Chile, Oman and Peru, with one expert branding it a 'national disgrace'&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByNicola Small21:32, 23 JUN 2018NewsBetween 2007 and 2016, 22 cyclists were killed and 368 were seriously injured due to crumbling roads, with the victim toll rising, figures show (Image: E+)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe nation’s most pothole-plagued roads are today revealed after a Sunday Mirror investigation. We surveyed every local authority to compile the list of shame – the streets that drew the most complaints. Our research was carried out after a study showed roads in Britain are worse than in Chile, Oman and Peru. And they are deadly. Between 2007 and 2016, 22 cyclists were killed and 368 were &shyseriously injured due to crumbling roads, with the victim toll rising. Last year an inquest heard Roger Hamer, 83, died from severe brain &shyinjuries after being flung off his bike when it hit a pothole in Ramsbottom, Greater Manchester.  We found the country’s worst road is Mellor Brook Bypass near Balderstone, Lancs. Motorists and cyclists reported it to the council 545 times in one year. Freedom of Information requests show Seven Hills Road in Elmbridge, Surrey, caused the second highest number of complaints, with 216 reported. Hundreds of drivers signed a petition demanding that the county council resurfaced it. One resident said they had seen FIVE different cars changing tyres at the &shyroadside, adding: “I will be avoiding this road until it is repaired.”  Another motorist said: “Incredibly dangerous trying to avoid huge, deep potholes, having to veer into oncoming traffic. Fed up with damage to my car. “Are they waiting for another needless death? Stop treating us with contempt.” Shocked drivers are hitting potholes and ruining tyres and their cars’ &shysuspensions, steering and underbodies, or losing control and having crashes. Edmund King, the president of the AA, said our investigation shows that right across the country, “our potholed roads are a national disgrace”, and are “fast becoming a national emergency”.  He said: “We are rescuing record numbers of drivers whose vehicles are damaged by potholes. Insurance claims for damage caused by potholes is soaring. “The lack of &shyinvestment on local roads means highway authorities are doing little more than papering over cracks, with drivers picking up the pieces.” He said February’s Beast from the East had made it worse – but was simply exposing years of &shyunderinvestment by cash-strapped councils.  In the first four months of 2018, AA Insurance received more pothole claims than in the  whole of 2017.   Our probe comes after the Asphalt Industry Alliance revealed 24,500 miles of local roads will need to be shut for repairs in the next year – and it would take at least 14years to clear the backlog, costing &pound9.3billion. A separate report by Cycling UK found local authorities have forked out &pound43.4million in compensation and legal costs due to potholes over the past five years. Sam Jones, of Cycling UK, said: “Before spending &pound15billion on new motorways and trunk roads, let’s fix the roads we use every day and are essential for us to get to work and drop the kids off at school.” National roads are to get 52 times more government funding by 2020 compared to local roads. Councillor Martin Tett, of the LocalGovernment &shyAssociation, said: “Only long-term, consistent and fairer investment in local roads can let councils embark on the improvements so desperately needed.”

story: NewsCampaigning mum reveals how she talked cops round after being arrested for medical cannabisCallie Blackwell says she told police she'll keep breaking the law as lives depend on it&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByKaren Rockett21:30, 23 JUN 2018NewsCallie gave cannabis oil to son Deryn&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA campaigning mum talked her way out of a cell after convincing police cannabis should be legal for medical use. Callie Blackwell, 38, was arrested after being seen holding a cannabis plant at a Westminster protest. She has been lobbying for the Class B drug to be allowed as a medicine since her son made a miracle recovery after she gave him liquid cannabis.  Today she continues to break the law by helping parents of sick children get access to medical cannabis through Bud Buddies UK.   Callie revealed she was arrested in February by three officers on suspicion of cultivating cannabis and held at London’s Charing Cross police station for six hours. She said: “I was like: ‘If you’re going to keep me here, I’ll tell you everything I know about cannabis’. “By the end of it they were like: ‘Just go, this is ridiculous’. They didn't even caution me. “I said to them: ‘Well what happens when I do this again?’ and they said I’d probably get a caution. “I told them I’m going to keep breaking the law because lives depend on it.”   Callie’s son Deryn was 14 when he was given days to live after four bone marrow transplants failed to halt his leukaemia . Two months after the final op, Callie risked jail by secretly giving Deryn liquid cannabis.  After five days his new bone marrow finally started to make blood cells. His immune system recovered and Deryn is now a healthy 18-year-old trainee chef. His mum was speaking in the wake of the row over Billy Caldwell, 12, of Co Tyrone, Ulster – who has cannabis oil to control seizures.

story: NewsHarry Kane swore he would win World Cup when he was just SEVEN as he prepares for Panama clashThe hero skipper told school pals about his devotion to the Three Lions ahead of tomorrow’s match in Nizhny Novgorod&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByPatrick Hill22:30, 23 JUN 2018NewsHarry Kane has dreamed of winning the trophy since his schooldays (Image: Daily Mirror)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email When Harry Kane leads the Three Lions out tomorrow, he moves a step closer to the goal he set aged seven.   Former school pal and footie team-mate Luke Robinson has &shyrevealed the England skipper – at the time sporting a David Beckham mohican – told him he was going to win the World Cup one day.  Speaking of Harry’s dream ahead of tomorrow’s Panama clash, Luke said: “He loved England and even then one of his biggest dreams was to play for England and win the World Cup. We’d watch the World Cup together and he was always a very proud England fan. “During the 2002 World Cup, Harry had his England shirt with Beckham on the back and the Beckham mohican. “He was so passionate, he was devastated when we went out.”  Luke, 24, was with Harry when he lifted the Essex &amp Waltham Forest District Cup as a 12-year-old in 2006. Now he, like the rest of the &shynation, hopes Harry will lift the coveted FIFA World Cup Trophy on July 15. And teacher Luke said if Harry does win the &shyultimate prize, it will be his proudest &shymoment. He said: “I remember once when Brazil were playing and they had the likes of Ronaldinho, Ronaldo and Roberto Carlos – some of my &shyfavourite players. “I was saying, ‘I’d love to play for Brazil!’. But Harry was like, ‘No, it’s got to be England! I’d love to play for England. That’s the country! That’s the thing!’. He’s that type of guy, England and proud.”  On Harry’s dedication, he said: “Everything was football. If he wasn’t watching football, he was speaking about football, playing football in the park or playing it on the computer. He did well at school and was good at other sports, like cricket, but it was football all day, every day. “In catering class, we had to bring a recipe and make a meal. He’d get a recipe from his chef at Tottenham and cook that so it was healthy. “He’s massive now but at school he was five foot eight or nine, and podgy. He shot up at 16 or 17. He did running and trained three or four times a week. By 16 or 17 he was fit as a fiddle. He put in years of dedication.”  Harry got England off to a flying start last Monday, scoring both goals in a dramatic 2-1 win against Tunisia – and Luke said the display was classic Kane. He said: “Back in school we knew if we needed a goal Harry could always get it. He’s still that sort of player now and the way he popped up with the winner against Tunisia was like back in his schooldays. I don’t see why he can’t win the golden boot.” Harry, 24, leads the line again today against minnows Panama. England’s second Group G game kicks off in Nizhny Novgorod, western Russia, at 1pm our time.  And someone else tipping him to go all the way is Ian Marshall, the chairman of Harry’s first team, Ridgeway Rovers – where Beckham also started out. And he said: “I bet if Harry won the World Cup he’d come back and see us with it. He’s a class act and we’re so proud. For a club like us to have two England captains in Harry and David, it’s something to shout about.” Meanwhile, England is set for a &pound382million party as it cheers on Harry and his boys today.  Retail experts reckon &pound65million will be spent in pubs, cafes and restaurants and &pound151million will go on food and drink at home. Some &pound20million will go on flags and souvenirs, &pound68million on shirts and &pound67million on TVs, website VoucherCodes and the Centre for Retail Research said.  Tesco expects to sell 140 million bottles and cans of beer. The chain’s booze boss Rob Cooke said: “There’s a real party atmosphere.”  Big brother's watching you Harry Kane has his biggest fan cheering him on in Russia – his lookalike older brother Charlie.

story: NewsMan given five-year football banning order after video of England fans singing anti-Semitic song at World CupMichael Herbert, 57, appeared at Leicester Magistrates' Court on Saturday, where he was handed a five-year football banning order, the National Police Chiefs' Council said&nbspShareByHenry Vaughan19:21, 23 JUN 2018Updated19:26, 23 JUN 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShareGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA man has been handed a five-year football banning order after a video appearing to show England fans singing an anti-Semitic song at the World Cup was shared online. Police investigating the clip served three men with notices under the 1989 Football Spectators Act. Michael Herbert, 57, appeared at Leicester Magistrates' Court on Saturday, where he was handed a five-year football banning order, the National Police Chiefs' Council (NPCC) said. Two other men, aged 52 and 58, appeared at Leeds Magistrates' Court, where the case was adjourned until Tuesday. Last week, the Football Association condemned the video, which appeared to show two men giving Nazi salutes in a Russian bar in Volgograd.  The southern Russian city, which was the venue of England's 2-1 win over Tunisia, was formerly known as Stalingrad - the site of one of the bloodiest battles in history when Soviet soldiers repelled Hitler's army during the Second World War. Last Wednesday, a spokesman for the FA said: We strongly condemn the actions of the people in this video. We are working with the relevant authorities, including the UK police investigations team, who are making inquiries to identify the individuals involved and take appropriate action. The disgraceful conduct of the individuals in this video does not represent the values of the majority of English football fans supporting the team in Russia.

title: mum spends 4k attend wedding
story: NewsMum spends £4k to attend wedding abroad - only to be told her five-month-old isn't welcomeAfter splashing the cash to attend a wedding overseas, a mother was shocked to discover her baby wasn't welcome at the ceremony&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByCourtney Pochin11:51, 23 JUN 2018Updated16:07, 23 JUN 2018News (Image: E+)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIt should have been a lovely trip. But a getaway to Australia for a family wedding turned into a bit of a nightmare for a mother from the UK.  A woman, going by the name Ashley W, shared her story on Netmums , revealing how she had spent &pound4,000 on flights for her family to attend her cousin's wedding down under.   But when they arrived, her family told her she would have to find a babysitter for her five-month-old daughter as children weren't invited.  The mum says she had known about the nuptials for a year and during that time no one had mentioned that her baby wouldn't be welcome at the ceremony.  It wasn't until the official invitation turned up three weeks before the big day, that she discovered there was going to be a problem. By this point it was too late, as she'd already booked flights for her family. She said: My cousin invited us to his wedding in Australia with 12 months notice. Sent us an email with the date no further info. My daughter is five months old. So my family said we would attend and we bought the flights.  She added: I chased for the actual invitation about 100 times and eventually it arrived three weeks before we flew. The invite said no children. I flagged that they really should have mentioned this before I bought the flight. When they arrived in Australia, her family weren't impressed that she had brought the child along and suggested she find a babysitter. She continued: Am I being unreasonable to think it's a joke they can't make an exception for a breastfeed baby flying from England?  Don't have kids at your wedding, no problem. Don't make me spend &pound4k on flights and accommodation to be told that my baby can't come. Other mums commented on the post that they would be furious if put in a similar position. One user said: OMG that's ridiculous! You're flying to the other side of the world... I personally wouldn't let strangers look after my child. I'd be fuming too! I totally get the no child thing, I really do, but this is definitely an exception.

title: raging dad who claims barber
story: NewsRaging dad who claims barber 'left him looking like Lloyd from Dumb and Dumber' posts furious videoChris Cook, 27, wanted to get a trim so he would look smart for work but instead says he was left looking like an " absolute idiot"&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByHelen Le Caplain15:21, 23 JUN 2018Updated17:43, 23 JUN 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA furious dad claims a barbershop left him with a bowl haircut that made him look 'like Lloyd from Dumb and Dumber'. Chris Cook, 27, wanted to get a trim so he would look smart for work but instead says he was left looking like an absolute idiot. He said the cut along with a beard trim cost &pound10 and called it garbage in video ranting about his new Jim Carey-inspired style. When Chris' usual salon was busy last Friday lunchtime, he instead decided to visit Smart Cuts in Cleckheaton, West Yorkshire, for a 'short back and sides'. The former infantry soldier claimed he left looking like his hair had been cut using a bowl. However salon owner Faz, who declined to give his surname, said they are experienced barbers. Faz said any unstyled hair 'is going to look horrible' and that if Chris was unhappy he should have returned to the salon to get the &pound5 cut rectified.  Chris, from Cleckheaton, said: I woke up cranky on the Saturday morning and when I caught sight of myself in the mirror I couldn't believe what I was seeing. I had a really long fringe and looked like Lloyd out of Dumb and Dumber. I just thought 'what the hell have they done to my hair? I can't go out looking like this'. It looked like a bowl cut. Once my mum stopped laughing at me I said to her 'you might as well have put a bowl round my head and saved me &pound10'. Cleaner Chris filmed a video raging about his barnet and posted it on social media. In the video he can be seen holding his phone to his face and lamenting his locks.  Chris can be heard saying: Right guys, went down [to] Cleckheaton yesterday for my hair cutting. I went down to Smart Cuts, [it] cost me a tenner, look at the state of this. Give me a little shave on the beard as well that's why it was a tenner. Short back and sides and a trim on the top, that's all I asked for. Now you can see it there, look at the state of that. So if you want to look like Lloyd off Dumb and Dumber and pay a tenner for it, get yourself down to Smart Cuts, absolutely garbage.  Two days later his trained hairdresser aunty Janene Crossley, 47, spent 20 minutes blending the style and Chris said he is now starting to see the funny side of it. Chris said: When I first shared the video there was no funny intention, it was just to show people. Next thing I know people are commenting and liking it and phone wouldn't stop pinging for two days, everybody was laughing at it. Chris said the hair cut fiasco started when he tried a different barbers for the first time. The dad of two said: I normally go to a different hairdressers but the one I usually go to was busy and there weren't a lot of people there. I tried this barbershop instead and went in for a short, back and sides. I don't tend to style my hair, I only do that when I go out. I just keep it kept cut short and neat so that it looks good at work and brush it to the side. I was in there for about 15 minutes and as he was cutting and shaving round the side of my head he kept brushing it into the style I have, it looked nice and neat. When I got home later that day I had a shower and the following day got up early and that's when I saw what it looked like. I just couldn't believe my hair, they'd messed it up. My mum's not a professional but she could have done a better job with a bowl. I looked an absolute idiot.

story: four years (Image: PA)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA Royal Navy sailor put his ship at risk – by posting its secret movements on Facebook. title: uk weather dramatic satellite image
story: NewsUK weather: Dramatic satellite image shows 'Spanish plume' set to bring Britain's hottest day for years as forecasters predict 35C heatThe UK will be warmer than Tahiti, French Polynesia, as even the north braces itself for all-time record highs&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByAlistair GrantDanya BazaraaNews Reporter12:11, 23 JUN 2018Updated12:43, 23 JUN 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A dramatic satellite image shows a 'Spanish plume' which is set to bring Britain's hottest day for three years.  Temperatures could reach 35C from Wednesday in parts of the country next week, forecasters say. The UK will be warmer than 28C in Tahiti, French Polynesia, as even the north braces itself for all-time record 31C highs. A weather map for Thursday shows the hot high-altitude air in orange and red.  After a marvellous Midsummer's Day tomorrow at 27C, the Met Office forecasts 30C by Tuesday and highs of around 33C on Wednesday and Thursday.  But up to 35C has been predicted for the south by The Weather Outlook as high pressure builds and hot air blows in from Spain, as seen in the weather map.  The Weather Outlook forecaster Brian Gaze said: It's a marvellous Midsummer's Day for most of Britain. Computer models show 35C isn't out of the question from midweek as temperatures continue to rise amid a Spanish plume of warm air. Temperatures could reach higher than Britain's hottest day since the 36.7C on July 1, 2015, at Heathrow, London, recorded by the Met Office.  The Met Office said Northern Ireland could break its 30.8C all-time temperature record, set on June 30, 1976, at Knockarevan in Co Fermanagh, and July 12, 1983, at Shaw's Bridge, Belfast. Met Office forecaster Alex Burkill said: It's already warm in the south and will be hot and sunny everywhere in the UK by Tuesday, with high pressure. Midweek could see the low 30s - so 30C to 33C - in the south. And it will be hot right up to the north of the UK, with a chance Northern Ireland could beat its all-time maximum temperature record of 30.8C.

title: wedding ring lost bottom lake
story: NewsWedding ring lost at bottom of lake for two months reunited with owner after water drainedSteve Watts lost the ring, which he had worn for 10 years, at Marine Lake in Clevedon, Somerset two months ago&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByDave Burke18:04, 23 JUN 2018Updated18:05, 23 JUN 2018NewsSteve Watts has been reunited with the lost ring, which has been missing for two months (Image: Clevedon Marine Lake)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA relieved married man has been reunited with a wedding ring he thought lost forever - after it was discovered by chance at the bottom of a lake. Steve Watts lost the ring, which he had worn for 10 years, at Marine Lake in Clevedon, Somerset two months ago. Although the odds of finding it were slim, two boys found it when the lake was being drained and handed it in. Now Mr Watts wants to find them and thank them for their good deed.  Volunteer Alan Wilson, who the boys handed the ring to, told the BBC that it was a chance in a million that the ring was found.   The lake is cleared once a year, and Mr Wilson said: There's 15,000 sqm of lake bed and they found this ring which is less than 20mm in diameter. But I didn't really take any details from them and after they gave me the ring, they just wandered off and I didn't see them again.

story: NewsIf you're from Manchester, Leeds or Sheffield, this professor thinks you're a southernerMark Tewdwr-Jones has sparked a furious debate about where the north-south divide REALLY lies in the UK&nbspShare&nbspCommentsBySophie Halle-Richards23:02, 23 JUN 2018News (Image: Manchester Evening News)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIf you're from Manchester, Leeds or Sheffield, you're actually a southerner, according to a top professor. Mark Tewdwr-Jones has sparked a furious debate about where the north-south divide really lies in the UK. The academic has drawn a new map which lumps the northern cities in with London and the Home Counties. Prof Tewdwr-Jones, a professor of town planning, says Manchester, Leeds and Sheffield can’t be classed as northern because they are influenced so much by the capital, the Manchester Evening News reports.   “There are several ways you could define a northern region - but perhaps the most pertinent question is where does London end?” he asks. “My map is a northern area defined as ‘not London,’ where London’s sphere of influence extends over most of the country - determined by two-hour commuting patterns which is becoming the norm.” Professor Tewdwr-Jones, who is chair of town planning at Newcastle University and has advised ministers on planning, land use and housing issues, argues that policymakers should adopt a more ‘nuanced’ view of what constitutes the North.

title: final moments youtube stuntmans life
story: NewsFinal moments of YouTube stuntman's life seen in harrowing footage as he forces nervous girlfriend to shoot him through bookMonalisa Perez was advised by Pedro Ruiz he would be shielded by a thick book as she took aim from close range&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByDanya BazaraaNews Reporter08:52, 23 JUN 2018Updated15:43, 23 JUN 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThese are the final moments of a wannabe YouTube star's life before he forced his nervous girlfriend to shoot him through a book in a stunt which left him dead and her jailed. Monalisa Perez, then 19 and pregnant with her second child, was advised by Pedro Ruiz, 22, he would be shielded by a thick book as she took aim from close range. But the stunt went horribly wrong and the bullet went straight through the 1.5-inch book and into Ruiz's chest, fatally wounding him. Dramatic footage newly released shows him encouraging his terrified girlfriend to pull the trigger, with a bullet inside he says can travel the length of three football pitches. In a transcript of the moments leading up to the shooting, Perez says: “Babe, I’m not doing this, I can’t.” “I don’t want to be responsible,” she adds.   But according to local reports , Pedro tells her: “You won’t as long as you hit the book, as long as you hit the book you’ll be fine. Come on. The batteries gonna die on it. Come closer.”  Before she pulled the trigger, transcripts showed she said: I can't do it babe. I'm so scared.  Babe, if I kill you what's gonna happen to my life. Like, no this isn't okay, she continued, the Daily Mail reports.  Eventually Perez pulled the trigger that ended Ruiz's life. Ruiz had introduced the video by saying his YouTube channel would have crazy stuff in it. Here I have my girlfriend Monalisa to help me out with my first video, a video shows him saying. So babe, let's go ahead and show them what we have in store, he said as she showed off a 50 caliber desert eagle gun placed on a red cushion.  He explains in the clip that he's going to ask Perez to 'clip the button' and she looks at him nervously asking is it hard to which he replies no, it's a button. It's basically a canon in your hand going off, he describes. Ruiz shows off how big both the gun and the bullet are in the footage. He says if he snaps his fingers the bullet could travel more than three football fields in length.  The point of this video is I really want to see if a 50 caliber bullet can go through a book, he says. I'm going to stand behind it, and Monalisa is going to shoot it, hoping she hits the book. Hoping she hits the book and not me, but the most trustworthy person that I trust in this world is my girlfriend, Monalisa, so if I'm going to die, I'm pretty much ready to go to heaven right now. If I die I'll be ready for Jesus. He probably won't accept me into the gates because of how stupid this is but I have confidence my girlfriend will hit the book and not me.  Before the incident, Monalisa Perez had tweeted: Me and Pedro are probably going to shoot one of the most dangerous videos ever. HIS idea not MINE.(sic).

story: NewsWould you have been able to spot this drowning girl the way this lifeguard did?The distressed young girl bops up and down in the water struggling to breathe in a packed swimming pool, believed to be in the US&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByCharlotte Neal14:17, 23 JUN 2018Updated17:39, 23 JUN 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA quick-thinking lifeguard saved a drowning girl's life as she repeatedly disappeared under the surface in a crowded swimming pool.
